explanation: The solution prints three separate lines using std::cout. The first two lines end with the newline character (\n) to match the lesson's exploration of escape sequences. The final line uses std::endl to demonstrate the alternative way of ending a line that also flushes the output buffer. Keeping an explicit return 0; communicates successful program termination, even though modern compilers allow omitting it.
keyPoints: std::cout streams text to the standard output
std::endl ends the line and flushes the buffer
Exact spelling and punctuation in output matters
